Authors: Zukarnain N., Abbas B.S., Wayan S., Trisetyarso A., Kang C.H.
Title: Spelling Checker Algorithm Methods for Many Languages
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Informatics, Faculty of Design and Technology Pembangunan, Jaya University, South Tangerang, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Zukarnain, N., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abbas, B.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wayan, S., Department of Informatics, Faculty of Design and Technology Pembangunan, Jaya University, South Tangerang, Indonesia; Trisetyarso, A., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kang, C.H., Department of Informatics, Faculty of Design and Technology Pembangunan, Jaya University, South Tangerang, Indonesia
Abstract: Spell checking plays an important role in improving document quality by identifying misspelled words in the document. The spelling check method aims to verify and correct misspelled words through a series of suggested words that are closer to the wrong word. Currently, Spell checkers for English language are well established. This article analyses several studies conducted in various types of languages other than English. Like Africa, Arabia, China, Indonesia, India, Japan, Malaysia and Thailand. We use the systematic literature Review approach to paper published 2008 - 2018. there are 23 papers to represent each language and view methods used. The result show that each language has a different Spelling Check Method. The Damerau-Levenshtein algorithm method is most often used for spelling checkers. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: algorithm method; spelling checker; systematic literature review
Index Keywords: Algorithm methods; Document quality; English languages; Indonesia; Spell-checking; Spelling checker; Spelling checks; Systematic literature review; Information management
